page.title: 02Crimble Mill.
page.content: The mill is used for{dyeing}and finishing material. It has been used for{textile work}since the late 1860's, when it was built. The bricks were made by hand. Under the mill was once a{coal}mine, now for heating they burn{oil.} The cloth is stored in the mill store room. In The Grey Room workers take cloth off the bales and number it. The{singeing}machine burns the rough parts of the material and the fine bits off the back. A machine is used to bleach the cloth which is passed through 8 times {Bleaching}was once done by laying the cloth in buttermilk and leaving it for 6 months.It is dried in a steam chamber. In the dyeing room are machines for dyeing the material. The mill makes the back of the Oxford Dictionary.
